required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of LY3041658 in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of LY3041658 in Healthy Subjects

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety of LY3041658 in healthy participants, including those of Japanese descent. The study will also investigate how the drug is processed and affects key immune cells. Study participation will last 4 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants with One or More Drug-Related Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of LY3041658
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through Day 85, at specified timepoints

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) from Time 0 to Time of Last Measurable Concentration (tlast)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through Day 85, at specified timepoints

arm_group.description: Single dose of LY3041658, administered as a slow IV infusion in escalating dose cohorts.
Single dose of LY3041658 administered SC
Single dose of placebo (0.9% sodium chloride injection) administered as a slow IV infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18.0 to 32.0 kilogram per square meter (kg/m2).
- Absolute neutrophil count at screening should be ≥1.8 and ≤7.2 x 10^3/microliter (uL), inclusive.
- A subset of participants (15 planned) must additionally qualify as first-generation Japanese: the participant, the participant's biological parents, and all of the participant's biological grandparents must be of exclusive Japanese descent and have been born in Japan. First-generation Japanese must be at least 20 years of age at the time of initial screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received antibody-based biologic agents (marketed or investigational) within 3 months or 5 half lives (t1/2) of the drug (whichever is longer) prior to screening.
